DOC.brief_summary: To determine the best time to begin anti-HIV(Acquired Immunodeficiency Syndrome) treatment in individuals who co-infected with HIV and tuberculosis (Tb). This prospective, randomized study is being conducted on HIV/Tb co-infected patients in China to evaluate and compare the efficacy of antiretroviral therapy after 2 weeks TB treatment versus deferred ART initiated 8 weeks after initiation of TB treatment.
DOC.brief_title: Acquired Immunodeficiency Syndrome(AIDS) and Tuberculosis(Tb) Co-infection Treatment Strategies Study of China.
DOC.detailed_description: Anti-Tb Therapy: 2HREZ-4HRifb(H:Isoniazid，R:Rifampicin，E:Ethambutol，Z：pyrazinamide，Rifb:Rifabutin) HAART: The first line was Zidovudine(AZT)+Lamivudine(3TC)+Efavirenz(EFV) and the second line is Stavudine(D4T)+3TC+EFV Study group one: after anti-TB therapy 2 weeks begin with High Active Antiretroviral Therapy(HAART); study group two: after anti-TB therapy 8 weeks begin with HAART. If begin with HAART and the H change with Rifb.
DOC.criteria: Clinical diagnosis of AIDS coinfected with TB CD4 T cell count lower than 350/ul Must be able to swallow tablets and finish the followup Sign the information consent form Chinese Can not tolerance the therapy estimated by the doctor.
